channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox, 29th November
item.description:
Dead fox on pavement in residential areas where children, and cats and dogs, live

item.title: Fridge, suitcases, pushchair and various other rubbish, 29th November
item.description:
Dumped rubbish next to tree near shop. Getting added to every night!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Vestry Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Trip hazard following pavement repair, 29th November
item.description:
Tarmac around tree has been pushed up by tree roots to create a large hump in the doorway. This now a significant trip hazard particularly at night as the defect in pavement surface cannot be easily seen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northfield Avenue, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crumbling uneven footpath, 29th November
item.description:
Someone came to repair the uneven footpath a few months ago but has now left it in a worse condition. The cement is crumbling away and the pavers are coming up and uneven. This is posing as a trip hazard and particularly dangerous as using the area to put my newborn into the car.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Domonic Drive, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Mary's Road, Nunhead, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish left outside Halcyon House., 29th November
item.description:
Consistently unsightly outside Halcyon House. Commercial waste from K&K grocers is placed in household waste bins outside Halcyon House, therefore there is a lot of rubbish consistently left outside.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 289,291, Walworth Road, Walworth, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Another criminal offence flyposted advertisement vinyl banner for Langley Park Boys School has been cabletied to the Council pedestrian guard railings at the junction of South Eden Park Rd and Hawksbrook Lane, Eden Park, Beckenham., 29th November
item.description:
Another criminal offence flyposted advertisement vinyl banner for Langley Park Boys School has been cabletied to the Council pedestrian guard railings at the junction of South Eden Park Rd and Hawksbrook Lane, Eden Park, Beckenham. The blue vinyl banner is about 1.5m x 0.75m. Seen 27th and 28th November 2025.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hawksbrook Lane, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please reinstate the height warning sign on the metal railway bridge, south side near 90a, Upper Elmers End Rd, Beckenham which was dislodged in a lorry strike about 9 months, ago., 28th November
item.description:
Please reinstate the height warning sign on the metal railway bridge, south side near 90a, Upper Elmers End Rd, Beckenham which was dislodged in a lorry strike about 9 months, ago. The substitute footway, pole-mounted sign is far less prominent and, I would say, inadequate. Bridge strikes cause huge disruption to road and rail traffic, and potential injury / death to drivers and passengers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing fox lane st sign, 28th November
item.description:
Replacement street sign as previous one is no longer there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Fox Lane, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside of 64 - 68 Canfield Gardens, 28th November
item.description:
The road surface is quite damaged with significant dips and potholes which leads to severe vibrations in my property whenever one of the C11 bus pass by. The problem is further aggravated when the bus is electric due to the increased weight of the machine. Considering the issue has been ongoing for months now, can you please urgently action a resurfacing of the road to prevent such holes and subsequent vibrations? thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Canfield Gardens, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
